question: What did the speaker's parents always do when he was little?
options: They could always take him to the park on Sundays
They would always take him to the park on Sundays
They had to take him to the park on Sundays
They wanted to take him to the park on Sundays
explanation: The sentence uses 'pouvaient' (imperfect of 'pouvoir') meaning 'could/were able to'. In this context, it expresses past ability or possibility: 'mes parents pouvaient toujours m'emmener' means 'my parents could always take me'. The imperfect here shows a repeated past action.
